awd_titl_txt: Strong Multi-Electron Interaction in Atomic Transition      (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: It is proposed to study the dynamical processes in atomic                  transitions dominated by strong multi-electron interactions.  The               intent is to develop physically realistic and computationally                   manageable theoretical procedures which can be applied to studies               of more complex atomic transitions.  Emphasis will be given to                  processes dominated by doubly excited states, both below and                    above the ionization threshold of quasi-two-electron atoms (two                 actively interacting electrons outside an easily pularizable                    cone).  Applications will be made to single and multi-step                      transitions in alkaline earth and other quasi-two-electron atoms.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
